statement.p: At a particular temperature and acidity bacillus megaterium will doube every 0.44 hours. Suppose we begin with 2.0 grams of the bacteris. Write an equation for the amount of bacteria after \displaystyle{t} hours.

solution.p: Because the amount doubles every \displaystyle{0.44} hours the number of doublings is \displaystyle\frac{{t}}{{0.44}}. Thus we have \displaystyle{2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{0.44}}}}. The (initial) amount doubled is \displaystyle{2.0}. Thus the model is \displaystyle{b}={2.0}{\left({2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{0.44}}}}\right)}.
